result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
4:28 PM Defendant Joseph James Esselman in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert Jambois appears on behalf of ADA Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel.
Defendant states that he had thought he was going to be appointed counsel.
Defendant had applied with the public defender's office via telephone.
Defendant would like to have an adjournment.
ADA Jambois makes statements.
Court reviews the file and states that there is no order appointing counsel and makes further statements.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is to go to the public defender's office on 08/02/22.
Preliminary Hearing is adjourned. 
Check in with the public defender's office on 08/12/22 to see if he has been appointed counsel.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:51 PM  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph James Esselman in court. 
Defendant state he did not get a copy of the criminal complaint. 
The State provided a copy of the complaint to the Defendant.
Court advises the Defendant can get an attorney.
BY THE COURT: Bond is continued.
Defendant waives time limits of preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Returned warrant from PCSO
Adjourned initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Do not possess/consume illegal drugs or controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Keep copy of prescription or prescription bottle on person.

12:59 PM Defendant Joseph James Esselman in court.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls the case.
Court verifies the defendant's address.

BY THE COURT: Warrant to be quashed. 

Court informs Mr. Esselman to take some time to read the criminal complaint while Court hears another case.

1:07 PM Court recalls the case.
Appearances are the same as previously stated. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

2:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph James Esselman not in court. 

Atty Pfeil requests a warrant. 
Court questions if the summons was sent. 
Atty Pfeil responds that it was sent at the end of April. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds the complaint states probable cause and authorizes a criminal warrant.  

Court questions any request for a cash alternative.
Atty Pfeil requests a $250 cash alternative.

BY THE COURT:  $250 cash alternative is ordered.
Initial Appearance set for May 16, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 1
